skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
Fierce beasts that will fight to the death any who enter their territory – be they man or Dragon!
A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

skillTree.localised_description: Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

skillTree.localised_description: Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Those whom the Lady has blessed fight with an unquenchable, almost super-human zeal, for they know that she sees them.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: In the glory of the charge is this Knight most alive, ever in the forefront of battle.
A master of the feint and riposte, this Knight's skill at turning an enemy's strength against them is legendary.
So great is this Knight's skill with a lance that none can unhorse them.
Haughty, proud, and skilful, this Knight never takes a backward step in the face of adversity.
Steeled by this Knight's bravery, those around them fight with the courage of the Breton himself.
With a heart of stone and resolute temper this Knight stands unbowed, spilling the foe's blood with each sweep and thrust.
Unbending even in the face of the greatest beasts, this Knight mounts their heads on the wall of his feasting chamber.
A hermit-Knight, this one nevertheless always returns to fight for his beloved king.
This Knight has great contempt for those who eschew the martial values of meeting one's opponent face to face.

"When the clarion call is sounded\\n I will ride out and fight in the name of Liege and Lady\\nWhilst I draw breath the lands bequeathed\\n unto me will remain untainted by evil\\n Honour is all, Chivalry is all..."

"I set down my lance, symbol of duty\\nI spurn those whom I love\\nI relinquish all and take up the tools of my quest\\nNo obstacle will stand before me\\nNo plea for help shall find me waiting\\nNo moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle\\nI give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek..."
"That which is sacrosanct I shall preserve\\n That which is sublime I will protect\\nThat which threatens I will destroy\\nFor my holy wrath will know no bounds..."
